protocol_name: Hyperemic myocardial blood flow quantification with CZT-based SPECT cameras and a rapid, single-scan rest/stress scan
protocol_name_html: Hyperemic myocardial blood flow quantification with CZT-based SPECT cameras and a rapid, single-scan rest/stress scan
description: This protocol describes how to calculate the hyperemic myocardial blood flow, a clinically critical parameter, with CZT-based SPECT and a single-scan rest/stress protocol that is proposed in our manuscript.
protocol_affiliation: Department of Biomedical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan
manuscript_citation: Fang YD, Liu Y, Ho K, Kuo F, Yang C, Yen T, Hsieh I (2017) Single-scan rest/stress imaging with 99mTc-Sestamibi and cadmium zinc telluride-based SPECT for hyperemic flow quantification: A feasibility study evaluated with cardiac magnetic resonance imaging. PLoS ONE 12(8): e0183402. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0183402
keywords: myocardial flow quantification, cadmium zinc telluride, single-photon emission computed tomography, myocardial perfusion imaging, coronary artery disease

authors_list.name: Yu-Hua Fang
authors_list.affiliation: Department of Biomedical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan

components.data: The first portion of the protocol describes the scan and data acquisition as follows.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The first portion of the protocol describes the scan and data acquisition as follows.

components.data: A subject under study was first injected with 10 mCi of 99mTc-Sestamibi under resting conditions as a bolus intravenous injection.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: A subject under study was first injected with 10 mCi of 99mTc-Sestamibi under resting conditions as a bolus intravenous injection.

components.data: After permitting uptake for 60 minutes, the subject was placed on the scanner table and a technologist carefully adjusted the patient position via scintigraphy such that the heart was placed at the center FOV.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After permitting uptake for 60 minutes, the subject was placed on the scanner table and a technologist carefully adjusted the patient position via scintigraphy such that the heart was placed at the center FOV.

components.data: Once the patient was appropriately positioned, data acquisition was initiated in list-mode and continued for 24 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the patient was appropriately positioned, data acquisition was initiated in list-mode and continued for 24 minutes.

components.data: After 5 minutes of scanning, the subject was pharmaceutically stressed with 0.142 mg/kg/min of dipyridamole that was slowly infused over 4 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 5 minutes of scanning, the subject was pharmaceutically stressed with 0.142 mg/kg/min of dipyridamole that was slowly infused over 4 minutes.

components.data: Five minutes after the end of dipyridamole infusion, 20 mCi of 99mTc-Sestamibi was intravenously injected as a bolus.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Five minutes after the end of dipyridamole infusion, 20 mCi of 99mTc-Sestamibi was intravenously injected as a bolus.

components.data: The scan was terminated 10 minutes after the second tracer injection.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The scan was terminated 10 minutes after the second tracer injection.

components.data: The second portion of the protocol describes the data analysis procedures.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The second portion of the protocol describes the data analysis procedures.

components.data: When a region of interest (ROI) was drawn and the corresponding time-activity curve was obtained, the first 5 minutes of the TAC included the activity from purely the resting state. To exclude the effect of residual activity in the resting state from the stress portion, the mean activity of the first 5 minutes was calculated and then subtracted from the whole TAC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When a region of interest (ROI) was drawn and the corresponding time-activity curve was obtained, the first 5 minutes of the TAC included the activity from purely the resting state. To exclude the effect of residual activity in the resting state from the stress portion, the mean activity of the first 5 minutes was calculated and then subtracted from the whole TAC.

components.data: To obtain the input function required for kinetic modeling analysis, a region of interest (ROI) was drawn in the left ventricular (LV) cavity over a short-axis slice. The residual activity of the rest acquisition was subtracted from that of the stress acquisition.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To obtain the input function required for kinetic modeling analysis, a region of interest (ROI) was drawn in the left ventricular (LV) cavity over a short-axis slice. The residual activity of the rest acquisition was subtracted from that of the stress acquisition.

components.data: Once the tissue stress TACs were determined for the LV and myocardium, the tissue TACs were fitted with a two-tissue-compartment model using the LV TACs as input functions with the COMKAT software. The estimated kinetic rate constant K1 was used to approximate the hyperemic MBF.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the tissue stress TACs were determined for the LV and myocardium, the tissue TACs were fitted with a two-tissue-compartment model using the LV TACs as input functions with the COMKAT software. The estimated kinetic rate constant K1 was used to approximate the hyperemic MBF.
